title: [BUG] Pooling argument in make_reduction is not usable
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
I am unable to use pooling argument on make_reduction, it will give this error when I try

TypeError: make_reduction() got an unexpected keyword argument 'pooling'

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.pipeline import make_pipeline
from sktime.forecasting.compose import make_reduction

regressor = make_pipeline(
    RandomForestRegressor(random_state=1),
)
forecaster = make_reduction(
    regressor,
    scitype="tabular-regressor",
    transformers=[WindowSummarizer(n_jobs=1)],
    window_length=None,
    strategy="recursive",
    pooling="global",
)
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
make_reduction will create a reduction forecastet with global pooling

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->

**Versions**
